text: rushing to rescue the injured in the
heart of Istanbul's tourist district
Turkish security forces reacted quickly
to the explosion sealing off the
historic Sultanahmet square the bomb
went off without warning just meters
from the blue mosque reportedly killing
10 and injuring around a dozen tourists
it was a suicide bomber
I saw body parts it was a chaotic scene
everybody was running around police
didn't know what to do either they
wanted to empty the square so you were
told there might be a second bomb so the
police cleared the people off the square
as investigations began into who was
behind the blast Turkey's president put
the blame on a Syrian suicide bomber but
he condemned several other groups as
well Cara lucha is fight against
terrorism will continue with
determination and and and in an ethical
manner for us there is no difference
between PKK dhk VC so-called Islamic
state only three months ago
Islamic state carried out a suicide bomb
attack in the Turkish capital Ankara
killing around a hundred people in July
there was another suicide bombing near
the Syrian border also blamed on Islamic
state and last year fighting resumed
between the PKK the outlawed Kurdish
separatist group and the Turkish
military Turkey is a big target for
several enemies previous terrorist
attacks there have been blamed on
left-wing extremists on Kurdish
separatists and on radical Islamists but
the greatest danger Turkey faces today
comes from across the border in Syria
Islamic states thousands of fighters in
Syria may well be tempted to step up
their attacks on Turkey the Turkish
government has been tightening its
control along its borders and allowing
us warplanes to take off from its
southern air base at Incirlik the longer
the Syrian conflict continues the
greater the threat to neighboring Turkey
Frank Gardner BBC News
